issues.name: USB stick not recognized in Alliance Update
issues.solution:
These incidents involve PCs running Windows 11.
WMIC component has been disabled by default on last Windows 11 version.

To resolve this issue on the affected PCs, you must install WMIC :

Follow the procedure described here: https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/windows-itpro-blog/how-to-install-wmic-feature-on-demand-on-windows-11/4189530

As a reminder, in any case, the USB key must be formatted in FAT32 with the name: EasyLink


Dealer user can use the tool (Format USB) published on this page : https://mdx.dcs.renault.com/allianceupdate.html

Dealer Master Data ( DMD ).description:
Note: DMD and User Manager (administration) are syncronized every night. meaning making changes in DMD will only take effect the next day

Contents:

  • Creating / Deleting users
  • Assigning site and job function

Prerequisites:

  • RNFI KIT installed on your device
  • A Token RNET with rights to DMD app through RenaultNet.

 

1. Creating / Deleting users

  • Go to RenaultNet and acces the DMD application



  • Select the desired company you which to add/detele a user
    Note: a company is not a site





    Create

  • Navigate to "employees" and click on on "+NEW"



  • Fill in the required fields (*) and click "Validate" 



    Follow-up => Assigning site and job function



    Delete

  • Navigate to "employees" select the user you want to delete throuh the checkbox on the left and click on on "DELETE" then "Yes" 




2. Assigning site and job function

Once the user is created, you still have to assign the site he is going to work at and indicate his function.

  • Navigate to "employees" and select the desired user



  • Go to "Locations & functions" and click on "+NEW" 



  • Carefully fill or modify all required information in the colum.
    ( Location, Maint location, Brand, Funciton, Main function, FTE )

    Important:

    Users can only be assigned to ONE location at a time. to assign mutliple sites please create a TWIN.

    make sure to check "Main Location" else the profile wont be created in the User Manager (administration).



  • Add other colums for each additional brand



    Note: FTE has to reach a sum of 100%

  • Click "VALIDATE"

Note: DMD and User Manager (administration) are syncronized every night. meaning making changes in DMD will only take effect the next day

Follow-up => Assigning a Token RNET to a user

Microsoft Intune IOS & Android.description:
Microsoft Intune is a cloud-based service that focuses on mobile device management (MDM) and mobile application management (MAM).

 

Renault applications on phone see procedures in Selfcare Portal 


Selfcare Portal Links:

IOS -  Configuring Intune IOS - BYOD
ANDROID -  Intune BYOD ANDROID_FW enrollment.pdf ( not yet updated )

issues.solution:
Protect Your Privacy & Security – Websites store cookies to track your online activity, which can lead to targeted ads or even potential security risks if sensitive data gets exposed. Clearing cookies regularly helps prevent tracking and keeps your personal information safer.

Bonus: It can also fix website issues (like login problems or outdated pages) and free up storage space, making your browser run smoother.

Supported browsers Chrome, Edge

  Removing Cache & Cookies using Chrome :

    • Open Chrome on your computer.
    • Click the three-dot menu (⋮) in the top-right corner.



    • Click on "Delete browsing data".



    • We found most succes using these settings =>
      Go to "Advanced" and select "All time" in the Time Range



    • Make sure "Download history", "Cookies and other site data" and "Cached images and files" are checked



    • Click "Delete data" to start the removal process



    • The "Delete browsing data" window will dissapear once the process is over. Restart your browser now to apply the changes and ensure a smooth experience.

 

 

Removing Cache & Cookies using Edge:

    • Open Edge on your computer.

    • Click the three-dot menu (⋮) in the top-right corner.



    • Click on "Settings".



    • Go to "Privacy, search and services" and click on "Choose what to clear"



    • We found most succes using these settings =>
      Select "All time" in the Time Range



    • Make sure "Download history", "Cookies and other site data" and "Cached images and files" are checked



    • Click "Clear now" to start the removal process



    • The "Delete browsing data" window will dissapear once the process is over. Restart your browser now to apply the changes and ensure a smooth experience.
issues.name: Remove Cache & Cookies

issues.solution:
Twin profiles are used incase users need access to multiple sites next to their main one. These profiles are exactly the same as any other profile aside that we won't assign any token RNET to it but instead combine/attach this profile to the main profile which already has a token 

Prerequisites:

  • RNFI KIT installed on your device
  • A Token RNET with rights to User Manager ( administration ) and DMD app through RenaultNet.

How to:

  • In DMD, head to the desired company you want to give acces to and create a new user by using the same credentiels as his main profile. DMD => Creating / Deleting users



  • The next day in the User Manager ( adminstration ) you should find more then one profile visible. although each one onto a different site

  • To combine/attach the secondary profile to the main one. make sure you select the main profile and drag the secondary onto it



    HINT:     You will succesfully have created the Twin when you see a dark shadow symbol added



  • You can now proceed to activating the profile and adding rights.
    Tokens =>     Assigning RNET rights to a user

  • Users with multiple profiles ( Twins ) will have the option to choose which profile they want to use upon entering RenaultNet

    Note: Once a profile chosen. you are stuck with it until you restart your browser
issues.name: Twin creation
Remove certificates from Windows
issues.solution:
Clearing out your certificates from Windows occasionally is a good idea because it helps remove expired, untrusted, or unused certificates that could pose security risks.

Over time, your system may accumulate certificates—some from websites, software, or old VPNs—that are no longer valid or trusted. Keeping these could:

  • Allow compromised or deprecated certificates to be used inappropriately.

  • Clutter the certificate store, making it harder to manage or audit for security.

  • Lead to compatibility issues with updated security policies or software.

Regular cleanup helps maintain a secure and streamlined certificate environment.

issues.name: No print jobs available
issues.solution:
Users printing jobs not visible on the printer



Possible symptoms:

  • Personal Print Manager ( PPM ) session disconnected
    ( Note: When connecting via SECUREPRINT, the Personal Print Manager session is disconnected after 4 hours, in compliance with the Renault safety policy )

  • Possible bug 

Prerequisites:

  • Connected to the Renault network through ethernet cable or Wifi

Possible solutions:

SECUREPRINT - Connecting to Personal Print Manager

  • Check if the PPM session is still connected by opening the "Personal Print Manager" app.



    Click on "Continue with browser".



    (Note: If you don't get the login pop-up above please disconnect your account from the app first


    Your web browser opens and displays the window below.





    Make sure you arrive back on this page and try the printing process again





  • Restarting your computer can possibly solve various issues or bugs

issues.name: Badge cannot be reused due to still being linked to other user
issues.solution:
Possible symptoms:

  • User has left the company and badge cannot be reused for someone else

Possible solutions:

  • Create a ticket to GET_WW_RLT_PRINTER_HP_REMOTE asking to unlink the user from the badge

    Subject: MFP - Badge Print Access - (Temp-0020)  / Reset Request (cause  IPN Account already deleted)

    Description: (Temp-0020) // (PB00829 - IGNASZEWSKI Tom  )   >  (His IPN Account already deleted)

Printer SecurePrint.description:
SecurePrint

SECUREPRINT has arrived! this newest printing tool which replaces PrintAnywhere is easier to use and will make your experience even greater! follow the steps carefully to sep up your new tool!

SelfCare Portal Links:

SECUREPRINT – First step
SECUREPRINT - Connecting to Personal Print Manager

Prerequisites:

  • ACE2 or ACE.net PC connected to the company network via WiFi, cable or VPN.
  • A valid badge.

Contents:

  • Installation of the SecurePrint Service
  • Initialization of the Personal Print Manager
  • Printing a document with SECUREPRINT

1. Installation of the SecurePrint Service ( skip to step 2 if already done )

  • In Windows, find and open "Company portal". 



  • Search for "SecurePrint" and make sure its installed. if not, go ahead and click "install"




2. Initialization of the Personal Print Manager (PPM)

  • In Windows, find and open Personal Print Manager Login.



  • Click on "Continue with Browser".



  • This will redirect to the browser where the printer service will initialize the user IPN. A promt will pop-up to head back to the Personal Print Manager app.



  • Add the SecurePrint printer to the list ( if not already done ) by clicking on "+ Find a new printer" and "+" to start the installation




  • Once the installation done, go to a printer and present your badge on the printer’s badge reader



  • Follow the instructions to register your badge by providing your email address




  • On your computer, you will receive an email in your mailbox. open the email and click on "Finish your enrollment". 
    ( This will not work using a smartphone )




3. Printing a document with SECUREPRINT

  • The print solution deployed on your workstation includes a SECUREPRINT print queue



  • Go to a printer, swipe your badge in front of the badge reader to authenticate.

  • Press the SECURE PRINT icon from the printer control panel, your ducoment(s) will be ready for printing

Tokens.description:
The USB Token allows you to authenticate to certain applications or services  such as Renault.net and all underlying apps 

Ordering Token RNET through SPR using reference: 77 11 392 297

Prerequisites:

  • RNFI KIT installed on your device
  • A Token RNET with rights to User Manager ( administration ) and DMD app through RenaultNet.
  • A new or recycled Token RNET. 

Contents:

  • Assigning a Token RNET to a user
  • Assigning RNET rights to a user
  • Unlocking a Token RNET
  • Recycling a Token RNET

 

1. Assigning a Token RNET to a user 

  • The day after a user has been created in DMD. A profile will be created in RenaultNet. These users profiles are visible through the "administration" app.



  • Using the searchbar at the top left corner, look for the new user using his first and lastname or with the user ID that was generated in with it.



  • At first, the users state will be set to "Canditate". by clicking on "Create account" the user will receive an IPN. This number usually starts with "DB" ( Dealer Belgium ) followed by a number

    ( note: this IPN is very important and is linked through various applications )





  • With the user state set to "Active" you can now generate a tempopary password. Take note of this password which we will be needing for the coming steps.

    This password can also be obtained by clicking on "Update Password"





  • You can now insert the new or recycled Token RNET
    ( note: it is recommended to only have 1 Token RNET inserted in the computer )
     
  • In Windows, find and open "IDX-SCM Vectury G2". 



  • Choose the correct Label eToken and click "Continue".



  • Insert user IPN and temporary password that was generated earlier and click "Continue"



  • Choose a new pincode for your token. Again to confirm then click "Continue"
    ( note: this pincode will be asked whenever you want to acces RNET applications )



  • Give it a couple seconds until you succesfully activated the RNET Token.




    HINT: You will notice a golden certificate icon meaning the user has an RNET Token assisgned 

 

2. Assigning RNET rights to a user

  • In the administration app, find the affected user and click on "Person rights".
    ( note: the user MUST have an email adres set else you will get an error. you can insert this email adress through "Update the person" )



  • Choose out of the "Available rights" which you want to give the user. you can also select packages along the users work title. Use the arrows to move them to the "Assigned rights" colom and vice versa




  • Click on "Update rights" to apply the changes

 

3. Unlocking a Token RNET

After the user failed to correctly input their pincode 5 times. the token will be blocked for security purposes. 

  • In the administration app, find the affected user and click on "Search token(s)"



  • Assisgned tokens have a green checkmark ✔ on them. you can also find a Token RNET by using the serial number written on the device and using the token icon above the searchbar.



  • Double click on the token with the green checkmark ✔. On the top right corner click "Unlock" 

  • Write the generated unlock code because we will need it for the upcoming steps. 




  • You can now insert the blocked Token RNET 
    ( note: it is recommended to only have 1 Token RNET inserted in the computer )
     
  • In Windows, find and open "IDX-SCM Vectury G2".

     

  • Choose the correct Label eToken and click "Continue".



  • This time, a message saying the Token RNET is blocked will appear. click on "Ok"



  • Insert the generated unlock code and click "Continue"



  • The Token RNET is unlocked a ready for use again

 

 

4. Recycling a Token RNET

Reusing previously assigned tokens is possible by recycling them through the "Administration" app. So do not throw the away after only one use.

  • In the administration app, find the affected user and click on "Search token(s)"



  • Assisgned tokens have a green checkmark ✔ on them. you can also find a Token RNET by using the serial number written on the device and using the token icon above the searchbar.



  • Double click on the token with the green checkmark ✔. On the top right corner click "Recycle" 



  • The token can now be reused for others users

WIFI.description:
Access wifi to Renault Drogenbos

3 options: 

  • Network "RenaultBelux" - ground floor only - everyone - password: Austral22

  • Network "WINET" - All floors - Only Internal personnel - login with IPN and ARCA password

  • Network "GUESTR" - All floors - everyone
    by using these procedures

    http://admhotspot.intra.renault.fr/

    step1: RENAULT HOT SPOT ACCOUNT - Create and Manage Accounts
    step2: RENAULT HOT SPOT ACCOUNT - Loging-in to Renault Hot Spot
